content.name: April Yi Wang
content.affiliation:
University of Michigan
School of Information

meat.p:
I am a Ph.D. student at the School of Information at the University of Michigan, advised by Professor Steve Oney and Professor Christopher Brooks. My research draws upon human-centered design techniques to explore challenges in shared sense-making in data scientistsâ€™ collaboration practices and reimagine programming interfaces to support collaboration. I conducted in-depth qualitative inquiries to understand how data scientists currently use computational notebooks for collaboration. I developed computational tools to facilitate shared sense-making in computational notebooks.

I received my B.Eng. in Computer Science from Zhejiang University and M.Sc. degree in Computer Science from Simon Fraser University, where my master thesis investigated non-programmers learning computational literacy.

p.news: Our Callisto paper received the honourable mention award on CHI 2020.
Our paper, "Callisto: Capturing the Why by Connecting Conversations with Computational Narratives" was accepted to CHI 2020 ðŸŒ´.
Our paper, "How Data Scientists Use Computational Notebooks for Real-Time Collaboration" received the best paper award at CSCW 2019.
Our paper, "How Data Scientists Use Computational Notebooks for Real-Time Collaboration" was accepted to CSCW 2019.
Our paper, "Designing Curated Conversation-Driven Explanations for Communicating Complex Technical Concepts" was accepted to VL/HCC 2019.
Traveling to CHI19, Glasgow. I will attend the workshop on Human-Centered Study of Data Science Work Practices. I am also a student volunteer this year.
Excited to start the new semester as a PhD student in Umich!
Our paper, "Mismatch of Expectations: How Modern Learning Resources Fail Conversational Programmers", received the honourable mention award on CHI 2018.
Presented our poster on conversational programmer at ICER'17, Tacoma WA.
Our paper on Social Cheatsheet was accepted to CSCW2018.
Attended CRA Women Grad Cohort Workshop 2017, Washington DC.

Proceedings of the ACM : Human-Computer Interaction, Computer-Supported Cooperative Work and Social Computing (CSCW 2021). To appear

April Yi Wang, Steve Oney and Christopher Brooks. 2019. Redesigning Notebooks for Data Science Education. Workshop on Human-Centered Study of Data Science Work Practices at ACM Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI19), Glasgow, UK, May 2019. [PDF]

April Y. Wang and Parmit K. Chilana. 2017. Investigating Learning Strategies of Conversational Programmers. ACM Conference on International Computing Education Research (ICER17), Tacoma, WA, August 2017. [PDF]

project.name: Investigating Learning Strategies of Conversational Programmers
project.abstract: Conducting interviews with 23 conversational programmers to investigate their learning strategies

project.abstract: Designing the user interface of a block-based programming solution for developing IoT applications.
